definitions.definition: The part of Earth which is not covered by oceans or other bodies of water.
Real estate or landed property; a partitioned and measurable area which is owned and on which buildings can be erected.
definitions.example: There are 50 acres of land in this estate.

definitions.definition: A country or region.
A person's country of origin and/or homeplace; homeland.
The soil, in respect to its nature or quality for farming.
definitions.example: wet land; good or bad land for growing potatoes

definitions.definition: (often in combination) realm, domain.
The ground left unploughed between furrows; any of several portions into which a field is divided for ploughing.
A shock or fright.
definitions.example: He got an awful land when the police arrived.

definitions.definition: A conducting area on a board or chip which can be used for connecting wires.
In a compact disc or similar recording medium, an area of the medium which does not have pits.
(travel) The non-airline portion of an itinerary. Hotel, tours, cruises, etc.
definitions.example: Our city offices sell a lot more land than our suburban offices.

definitions.definition: The ground or floor.
The lap of the strakes in a clinker-built boat; the lap of plates in an iron vessel; called also landing.
In any surface prepared with indentations, perforations, or grooves, that part of the surface which is not so treated, such as the level part of a millstone between the furrows.
A group of dwellings or tenements under one roof and having a common entry.
To descend to a surface, especially from the air.
definitions.example: The plane is about to land.

definitions.definition: To alight, to descend from a vehicle.
To come into rest.
To arrive at land, especially a shore, or a dock, from a body of water.
To bring to land.
definitions.example: It can be tricky to land a helicopter.

definitions.definition: To acquire; to secure.
To deliver.
